block.p: Vivian Ann Fu, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Whei-Rung Fu of McLean, Va., is to be married this evening to Dr. Hank Hong Roan Chen, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles S. Chen of Los Angeles. The Rev. Barbara Kohn, a Zen Buddhist priest, is to perform the ceremony at the Viansa Winery in Sonoma, Calif.

Ms. Fu, who is keeping her name, was until April a vice president for strategic planning at oneNest.com, a Web site based in New York that puts sellers of handmade items in touch with wholesalers. She graduated with honors from Stanford University and received a law degree from Harvard.

Vivian Ann Fu, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Whei-Rung Fu of McLean, Va., is to be married this evening to Dr. Hank Hong Roan Chen, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles S. Chen of Los Angeles. The Rev. Barbara Kohn, a Zen Buddhist priest, is to perform the ceremony at the Viansa Winery in Sonoma, Calif.

Ms. Fu, who is keeping her name, was until April a vice president for strategic planning at oneNest.com, a Web site based in New York that puts sellers of handmade items in touch with wholesalers. She graduated with honors from Stanford University and received a law degree from Harvard.
The bride's father is a founding member of American Radiology Associates in Baltimore. Her mother, Annie W. Fu, is a real estate agent at Better Homes Realty in McLean.

Dr. Chen was until last month a resident in diagnostic radiology at the Mallinckrodt Institute of Radiology of Washington University in St. Louis. He graduated with high honors from the University of California at Berkeley and received his medical degree from the University of California at Los Angeles.
The bridegroom's father owns Swess-Hao Ltd., a Southeast Asian distributor of American products, based in Taipei, Taiwan.
